title: Installation
text: Rust 1.66.0 later R 4.0.0 later (Windows requires 4.2+) Apple silicon users (M1, M2, etc) need arm64 version R installed. can check platform installed running R --version terminal. see x86_64 output, please download arm64 version R-Project website.

title: Installation
text: Install Rust according instructions : https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install Install R package CRAN latest version WebGestaltR problems installing package, please create issue.
code: install.packages("WebGestaltR")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jing Wang. Author. John Elizarraras. Author, maintainer. Yuxing Liao. Author. Eric Jaehnig. Contributor. Zhiao Shi. Contributor. Quanhu Sheng. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wang J, Elizarraras J, Liao Y (2023). WebGestaltR: Gene Set Analysis Toolkit WebGestaltR. R package version 0.4.6,  https://iblacksand.github.io/WebGestaltR/, https://github.com/bzhanglab/WebGestaltR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {WebGestaltR: Gene Set Analysis Toolkit WebGestaltR},   author = {Jing Wang and John Elizarraras and Yuxing Liao},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.4.6,  https://iblacksand.github.io/WebGestaltR/},   url = {https://github.com/bzhanglab/WebGestaltR}, }

title: Gene Set Analysis Toolkit WebGestaltR
text: [!IMPORTANT] new version WebGestaltR requires Rust, must installed device prior installing updating package CRAN. See installation section information. WebGestalt R package R version well-known web application tool WebGestalt (www.webgestalt.org) average 27,000 users 140 countries territories per year also cited 371 2016. advantage R package can easily integrated pipelines simultaneously analyze multiple gene lists. WebGestaltR function can perform popular enrichment analyses: ORA (-Representation Analysis), GSEA (Gene Set Enrichment Analysis) NTA (Network Topology Analysis). Based user-uploaded gene list gene list scores (GSEA method), WebGestaltR function first map gene list entrez gene IDs summarize gene list based GO (Gene Ontology) Slim data. performing enrichment analysis, WebGestaltR function also returns user-friendly HTML report containing GO Slim summary enrichment analysis result. functional categories DAG (directed acyclic graph) structure, structure enriched categories can also visualized report.

title: Gene Set Analysis Toolkit WebGestaltR
text: R (>= 4.0.0) Rust (>= 1.63.0) Since WebGestaltR v1.0.0, Rust used core computations R package. Therefore, install WebGestaltR, please download install Rust https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install. Mac, Linux, Unix users, Rust can installed command line, Windows users can download GUI installer. Make sure restart terminal installing Rust ensure Rust compiler available path. can check Rust installed correctly running rustc --version terminal. installing Rust, can install WebGestaltR running following command R session: installation, Rust compiler called build computation library used WebGestaltR. run problems installation new version, please open new issue.
code: # install.packages("devtools") # run if devtools not already installed devtools::install_github("iblacksand/WebGestaltR")

title: Gene Set Analysis Toolkit WebGestaltR
text: [!NOTE] Besides change installation, difference R package performs existing use-cases. experience difference results due data-update, considered bug. Please report changes experience new issue. WebGestaltR’s core re-written Rust, dramatically increased performance, 15x speed previous versions. new version also supports metabolomics, support 15 different ID types.

what: WebGestaltR: The R interface for enrichment analysis with WebGestalt. — WebGestaltR
title: WebGestaltR: The R interface for enrichment analysis with WebGestalt. — WebGestaltR
text: Main function enrichment analysis

title: WebGestaltR: The R interface for enrichment analysis with WebGestalt. — WebGestaltR
code: WebGestaltR(   enrichMethod = "ORA",   organism = "hsapiens",   enrichDatabase = NULL,   enrichDatabaseFile = NULL,   enrichDatabaseType = NULL,   enrichDatabaseDescriptionFile = NULL,   interestGeneFile = NULL,   interestGene = NULL,   interestGeneType = NULL,   interestGeneNames = NULL,   collapseMethod = "mean",   referenceGeneFile = NULL,   referenceGene = NULL,   referenceGeneType = NULL,   referenceSet = NULL,   minNum = 10,   maxNum = 500,   sigMethod = "fdr",   fdrMethod = "BH",   fdrThr = 0.05,   topThr = 10,   reportNum = 20,   perNum = 1000,   gseaP = 1,   isOutput = TRUE,   outputDirectory = getwd(),   projectName = NULL,   dagColor = "continuous",   saveRawGseaResult = FALSE,   gseaPlotFormat = c("png", "svg"),   setCoverNum = 10,   networkConstructionMethod = NULL,   neighborNum = 10,   highlightType = "Seeds",   highlightSeedNum = 10,   nThreads = 1,   cache = NULL,   hostName = "https://www.webgestalt.org/",   useWeightedSetCover = FALSE,   useAffinityPropagation = FALSE,   usekMedoid = TRUE,   kMedoid_k = 25,   ... )  WebGestaltRBatch(   interestGeneFolder = NULL,   enrichMethod = "ORA",   isParallel = FALSE,   nThreads = 3,   ... )

title: WebGestaltR: The R interface for enrichment analysis with WebGestalt. — WebGestaltR
text: enrichMethod Enrichment methods: ORA, GSEA NTA. organism Currently, WebGestaltR supports 12 organisms. Users can use function listOrganism check available organisms. Users can also input others perform enrichment analysis organisms supported WebGestaltR. organisms, users need provide functional categories, interesting list reference list (ORA method). WebGestaltR perform ID mapping organisms, data ID type. enrichDatabase functional categories enrichment analysis. Users can use function listGeneSet check available functional databases selected organism. Multiple databases vector supported ORA GSEA. enrichDatabaseFile Users can provide one GMT files functional category enrichment analysis. extension file gmt first column file category ID, second one external link category. Genes annotated category third column. columns separated tabs. GMT files combined enrichDatabase. enrichDatabaseType ID type genes enrichDatabaseFile. users set organism others, users need set ID type WebGestaltR perform ID mapping organisms. supported ID types WebGestaltR selected organism can found function listIdType. enrichDatabaseDescriptionFile Users can also provide description files custom enrichDatabaseFile. extension description file des. description file contains two columns: first column category ID exactly category ID custom enrichDatabaseFile second column description category. columns separated tabs. interestGeneFile enrichMethod ORA NTA, extension interestGeneFile txt file can contain one column: interesting gene list. enrichMethod GSEA, extension interestGeneFile rnk file contain two columns separated tab: gene list corresponding scores. interestGene Users can also use R object input. enrichMethod ORA NTA, interestGene R vector object containing interesting gene list. enrichMethod GSEA, interestGene R data.frame object containing two columns: gene list corresponding scores. interestGeneType ID type interesting gene list. supported ID types WebGestaltR selected organism can found function listIdType. organism others, users need set parameter. interestGeneNames names id lists multiomics data. collapseMethod method collapse duplicate IDs scores. mean, median, min max represent mean, median, minimum maximum scores duplicate IDs. referenceGeneFile ORA method, users need upload reference gene list. extension referenceGeneFile txt file can contain one column: reference gene list. referenceGene ORA method, users can also use R object reference gene list. referenceGene R vector object containing reference gene list. referenceGeneType ID type reference gene list. supported ID types WebGestaltR selected organism can found function listIdType. organism others, users need set parameter. referenceSet Users can directly select reference set existing platforms WebGestaltR need provide reference set referenceGeneFile. existing platforms supported WebGestaltR can found function listReferenceSet. referenceGeneFile refereneceGene NULL, WebGestaltR use referenceSet reference gene set. Otherwise, WebGestaltR use user supplied reference set enrichment analysis. minNum WebGestaltR exclude categories number annotated genes less minNum enrichment analysis. default 10. maxNum WebGestaltR exclude categories number annotated genes larger maxNum enrichment analysis. default 500. sigMethod Two methods significance available WebGestaltR: fdr top. fdr means enriched categories identified based FDR top means categories ranked based FDR select top categories enriched categories. default fdr. fdrMethod ORA method, WebGestaltR supports five FDR methods: holm, hochberg, hommel, bonferroni, BH . default BH. fdrThr significant threshold fdr method. default 0.05. topThr threshold top method. default 10. reportNum number enriched categories visualized final report. default 20. larger reportNum may slow render report. perNum number permutations GSEA method. default 1000. gseaP exponential scaling factor phenotype score. default 1. p=0, ES reduces standard K-S statistics (See original paper details). isOutput isOutput TRUE, WebGestaltR create folder named projectName save results folder. Otherwise, WebGestaltR return R data.frame object containing enrichment results. hundreds gene list need analyzed simultaneously, better set isOutput FALSE. default TRUE. outputDirectory output directory results. projectName name project. projectName NULL, WebGestaltR use time stamp project name. dagColor dagColor binary, significant terms DAG structure colored steel blue ORA method steel blue (positive related) dark orange (negative related) GSEA method. dagColor continous, significant terms DAG structure colored color gradient based corresponding FDRs. saveRawGseaResult Whether raw result GSEA saved RDS file, can  used plotting. Defaults FALSE. list includes Enrichment_Results data frame GSEA results statistics Running_Sums matrix running sum scores gene set Items_in_Set list ranks genes gene set gseaPlotFormat graphic format GSEA enrichment plots. Either svg, png, c("png", "svg") (default). setCoverNum number expected gene sets set cover reduce redundancy. get fewer sets coverage reaches 100%. default 10. networkConstructionMethod Netowrk construction method NTA. Either Network_Retrieval_Prioritization Network_Expansion. Network Retrieval & Prioritization first uses random walk analysis calculate random walk probabilities input seeds, identifies relationships among seeds selected network returns retrieval sub-network. seeds top random walk probabilities highlighted sub-network. Network Expansion first uses random walk analysis rank genes selected network based network proximity input seeds return expanded sub-network nodes input seeds top ranking neighbors edges represent relationships. neighborNum number neighbors include NTA Network Expansion method. highlightType type nodes highlight NTA Network Expansion method, either Seeds Neighbors. highlightSeedNum number top input seeds highlight NTA Network Retrieval & Prioritizaiton method. nThreads number cores use GSEA set cover, batch function. cache directory save data cache reuse. Defaults NULL disabled. hostName server URL accessing data. Mostly development purposes. useWeightedSetCover Use weighted set cover ORA. Defaults TRUE. useAffinityPropagation Use affinity propagation ORA. Defaults FALSE. usekMedoid Use k-medoid ORA. Defaults TRUE. kMedoid_k number clusters k-medoid. Defaults 25. ... batch function, passes parameters WebGestaltR function. Also handles backward compatibility parameters old versions. interestGeneFolder Run WebGestaltR gene list files folder. isParallel jobs run parallelly batch.

title: WebGestaltR: The R interface for enrichment analysis with WebGestalt. — WebGestaltR
text: WebGestaltR function returns data frame containing enrichment analysis   result also outputs user-friendly HTML report isOutput TRUE.   columns data frame depend enrichMethod following:  geneSet ID gene set. description Description gene set available. link Link data source. size number genes set filtering minNum maxNum. overlap number mapped input genes annotated gene set. expect Expected number input genes annotated gene set. enrichmentRatio Enrichment ratio, overlap / expect. enrichmentScore Enrichment score, maximum running sum scores ranked list. normalizedEnrichmentScore Normalized enrichment score, normalized average       enrichment score permutations. leadingEdgeNum Number genes/phosphosites leading edge. pValue P-value hypergeometric test ORA. GSEA, please refer original       publication online https://software.broadinstitute.org/gsea/doc/GSEAUserGuideTEXT.htm. FDR Corrected P-value mulilple testing fdrMethod ORA. overlapId gene/phosphosite IDs overlap ORA (entrez gene IDs       phosphosite sequence). leadingEdgeId Genes/phosphosites leading edge entrez gene ID       phosphosite sequence. userId gene/phosphosite IDs overlap ORA leadingEdgeId       GSEA User input IDs. plotPath Path GSEA enrichment plot. database Name source database multiple enrichment databases given. goId NTA, like geneSet, enriched GO terms genes       returned subnetwork. interestGene NTA, gene IDs subnetwork 0/1 annotations indicating       user input. WebGestaltRBatch function returns list enrichment results.

title: WebGestaltR: The R interface for enrichment analysis with WebGestalt. — WebGestaltR
text: WebGestaltR function can perform three enrichment analyses: ORA (-Representation Analysis) GSEA (Gene Set Enrichment Analysis).NTA (Network Topology Analysis). Based user-uploaded gene list gene list scores, WebGestaltR function first map gene list entrez gene ids summarize gene list based GO (Gene Ontology) Slim. performing enrichment analysis, WebGestaltR function also returns user-friendly HTML report containing GO Slim summary enrichment analysis result. functional categories DAG (directed acyclic graph) structure genes functional categories network structure, relationship can also visualized report.

title: WebGestaltR: The R interface for enrichment analysis with WebGestalt. — WebGestaltR
code: if (FALSE) { ####### ORA example ######### geneFile <- system.file("extdata", "interestingGenes.txt", package = "WebGestaltR") refFile <- system.file("extdata", "referenceGenes.txt", package = "WebGestaltR") outputDirectory <- getwd() enrichResult <- WebGestaltR(   enrichMethod = "ORA", organism = "hsapiens",   enrichDatabase = "pathway_KEGG", interestGeneFile = geneFile,   interestGeneType = "genesymbol", referenceGeneFile = refFile,   referenceGeneType = "genesymbol", isOutput = TRUE,   outputDirectory = outputDirectory, projectName = NULL )  ####### GSEA example ######### rankFile <- system.file("extdata", "GeneRankList.rnk", package = "WebGestaltR") outputDirectory <- getwd() enrichResult <- WebGestaltR(   enrichMethod = "GSEA", organism = "hsapiens",   enrichDatabase = "pathway_KEGG", interestGeneFile = rankFile,   interestGeneType = "genesymbol", sigMethod = "top", topThr = 10, minNum = 5,   outputDirectory = outputDirectory )  ####### NTA example ######### enrichResult <- WebGestaltR(   enrichMethod = "NTA", organism = "hsapiens",   enrichDatabase = "network_PPI_BIOGRID", interestGeneFile = geneFile,   interestGeneType = "genesymbol", sigMethod = "top", topThr = 10,   outputDirectory = getwd(), highlightSeedNum = 10,   networkConstructionMethod = "Network_Retrieval_Prioritization" ) }

title: WebGestaltRMultiOmics — WebGestaltRMultiOmics
text: Perform multi-omics analysis using WebGestaltR

title: WebGestaltRMultiOmics — WebGestaltRMultiOmics
code: WebGestaltRMultiOmics(   analyteLists = NULL,   analyteListFiles = NULL,   analyteTypes = NULL,   enrichMethod = "ORA",   organism = "hsapiens",   enrichDatabase = NULL,   enrichDatabaseFile = NULL,   enrichDatabaseType = NULL,   enrichDatabaseDescriptionFile = NULL,   collapseMethod = "mean",   minNum = 10,   maxNum = 500,   fdrMethod = "BH",   sigMethod = "fdr",   fdrThr = 0.05,   topThr = 10,   reportNum = 100,   setCoverNum = 10,   perNum = 1000,   gseaP = 1,   isOutput = TRUE,   outputDirectory = getwd(),   projectName = NULL,   dagColor = "binary",   saveRawGseaResult = FALSE,   gseaPlotFormat = "png",   nThreads = 1,   cache = NULL,   hostName = "https://www.webgestalt.org/",   useWeightedSetCover = TRUE,   useAffinityPropagation = FALSE,   usekMedoid = FALSE,   kMedoid_k = 25,   isMetaAnalysis = TRUE,   mergeMethod = "mean",   normalizationMethod = "rank",   referenceLists = NULL,   referenceListFiles = NULL,   referenceTypes = NULL,   listNames = NULL )

title: WebGestaltRMultiOmics — WebGestaltRMultiOmics
text: analyteLists vector ID type corresponding interesting analyte list. supported ID types WebGestaltR selected organism can found function listIdType. organism others, users need set parameter. length analyteLists length analyteListFiles analyteLists. analyteListFiles enrichMethod ORA, extension analyteListFiles txt file can contain one column: interesting analyte list. enrichMethod GSEA, extension analyteListFiles rnk files contain two columns separated tab: analyte list corresponding scores. analyteTypes vector containing ID types analyte lists. enrichMethod Enrichment methods: ORAor GSEA. organism Currently, WebGestaltR supports 12 organisms. Users can use function listOrganism check available organisms. Users can also input others perform enrichment analysis organisms supported WebGestaltR. organisms, users need provide functional categories, interesting list reference list (ORA method). WebGestaltR perform ID mapping organisms, data ID type. enrichDatabase functional categories enrichment analysis. Users can use function listGeneSet check available functional databases selected organism. Multiple databases vector supported ORA GSEA. enrichDatabaseFile Users can provide one GMT files functional category enrichment analysis. extension file gmt first column file category ID, second one external link category. Genes annotated category third column. columns separated tabs. GMT files combined enrichDatabase. enrichDatabaseType ID type genes enrichDatabaseFile. users set organism others, users need set ID type WebGestaltR perform ID mapping organisms. supported ID types WebGestaltR selected organism can found function listIdType. enrichDatabaseDescriptionFile Users can also provide description files custom enrichDatabaseFile. extension description file des. description file contains two columns: first column category ID exactly category ID custom enrichDatabaseFile second column description category. columns separated tabs. collapseMethod method collapse duplicate IDs scores. mean, median, min max represent mean, median, minimum maximum scores duplicate IDs. minNum WebGestaltR exclude categories number annotated genes less minNum enrichment analysis. default 10. maxNum WebGestaltR exclude categories number annotated genes larger maxNum enrichment analysis. default 500. fdrMethod ORA method, WebGestaltR supports five FDR methods: holm, hochberg, hommel, bonferroni, BH . default BH. sigMethod Two methods significance available WebGestaltR: fdr top. fdr means enriched categories identified based FDR top means categories ranked based FDR select top categories enriched categories. default fdr. fdrThr significant threshold fdr method. default 0.05. topThr threshold top method. default 10. reportNum number enriched categories visualized final report. default 20. larger reportNum may slow render report. setCoverNum number expected gene sets set cover reduce redundancy. get fewer sets coverage reaches 100%. default 10. perNum number permutations GSEA method. default 1000. gseaP exponential scaling factor phenotype score. default 1. p=0, ES reduces standard K-S statistics (See original paper details). isOutput isOutput TRUE, WebGestaltR create folder named projectName save results folder. Otherwise, WebGestaltR return R data.frame object containing enrichment results. hundreds gene list need analyzed simultaneously, better set isOutput FALSE. default TRUE. outputDirectory output directory results. projectName name project. projectName NULL, WebGestaltR use time stamp project name. dagColor dagColor binary, significant terms DAG structure colored steel blue ORA method steel blue (positive related) dark orange (negative related) GSEA method. dagColor continous, significant terms DAG structure colored color gradient based corresponding FDRs. saveRawGseaResult Whether raw result GSEA saved RDS file, can  used plotting. Defaults FALSE. list includes Enrichment_Results data frame GSEA results statistics Running_Sums matrix running sum scores gene set Items_in_Set list ranks genes gene set gseaPlotFormat graphic format GSEA enrichment plots. Either svg, png, c("png", "svg") (default). nThreads number cores use GSEA set cover, batch function. cache directory save data cache reuse. Defaults NULL disabled. hostName server URL accessing data. Mostly development purposes. useWeightedSetCover Use weighted set cover ORA. Defaults TRUE. useAffinityPropagation Use affinity propagation ORA. Defaults FALSE. usekMedoid Use k-medoid ORA. Defaults TRUE. kMedoid_k number clusters k-medoid. Defaults 25. isMetaAnalysis whether perform meta-analysis. Defaults TRUE. mergeMethod method merge results multiple omics (options: mean, max). used isMetaAnalysis = FALSE. Defaults mean. normalizationMethod method normalize results multiple omics (options: rank, median, mean). used isMetaAnalysis = FALSE. referenceLists ORA method, users can also use R object reference gene list. referenceLists R vector object containing reference gene list. referenceListFiles ORA method, users need upload reference gene list. extension referenceListFile txt file can contain one column: reference gene list. referenceTypes Vector ID types reference lists. supported ID types WebGestaltR selected organism can found function listIdType. organism others, users need set parameter. listNames names analyte lists.

title: Affinity Propagation — affinityPropagation
text: Use affinity propagation cluster similar gene sets reduce redundancy report.

Users can also input others perform enrichment analysis organisms supported WebGestaltR. organisms, users need provide functional categories, interesting list reference list (ORA method). WebGestaltR perform ID mapping organisms, data ID type. geneList list input genes. outputFile Output file name. outputType File format plot: pdf, bmp png. isOutput Boolean plot save outputFile. cache directory save data cache reuse. Defaults NULL disabled. hostName server URL accessing data. Mostly development purposes.

title: Load gene set data — loadGeneSet

title: Load gene set data — loadGeneSet
code: loadGeneSet(   organism = "hsapiens",   enrichDatabase = NULL,   enrichDatabaseFile = NULL,   enrichDatabaseType = NULL,   enrichDatabaseDescriptionFile = NULL,   cache = NULL,   hostName = "https://www.webgestalt.org/",   isMultiOmics = FALSE )

title: Load gene set data — loadGeneSet
text: organism Currently, WebGestaltR supports 12 organisms. Users can use function listOrganism check available organisms. Users can also input others perform enrichment analysis organisms supported WebGestaltR. organisms, users need provide functional categories, interesting list reference list (ORA method). WebGestaltR perform ID mapping organisms, data ID type. enrichDatabase functional categories enrichment analysis. Users can use function listGeneSet check available functional databases selected organism. Multiple databases vector supported ORA GSEA. enrichDatabaseFile Users can provide one GMT files functional category enrichment analysis. extension file gmt first column file category ID, second one external link category. Genes annotated category third column. columns separated tabs. GMT files combined enrichDatabase. enrichDatabaseType ID type genes enrichDatabaseFile. users set organism others, users need set ID type WebGestaltR perform ID mapping organisms. supported ID types WebGestaltR selected organism can found function listIdType. enrichDatabaseDescriptionFile Users can also provide description files custom enrichDatabaseFile. extension description file des. description file contains two columns: first column category ID exactly category ID custom enrichDatabaseFile second column description category. columns separated tabs. cache directory save data cache reuse. Defaults NULL disabled. hostName server URL accessing data. Mostly development purposes. isMultiOmics Boolean loading gene sets multiomics. Defaults FALSE.

title: Load gene set data — loadGeneSet
text: list geneSet, geneSetDes, geneSetDag, geneSetNet, standardId. geneSet Gene set: data frame columns "geneSet", "description", "genes" geneSetDes Description: data frame columns two columns gene set ID description geneSetDag DAG: edge list data frame two columns parent child. list data frames multilple databases given. geneSetNet Network: edge list data frame two columns connecting nodes. list data frames multilple databases given. standardId standard ID gene set

what: Site Weighted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — multiswGsea
title: Site Weighted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — multiswGsea
text: Performs site weighted gene set enrichment analysis standard GSEA likelihood/weight columns input_df 1 0, p=1, q=1 thresh_type="val".

title: Site Weighted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — multiswGsea
code: multiswGsea(   input_df_list,   thresh_type = "percentile",   thresh = 0.9,   thresh_action = "exclude",   min_set_size = 10,   max_set_size = 500,   max_score = "max",   min_score = "min",   psuedocount = 0.001,   perms = 1000,   p = 1,   q = 1,   nThreads = 1,   rng_seed = 1,   fork = FALSE,   fdrMethod = "BH" )

title: Site Weighted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — multiswGsea
text: input_df_list data frame first column name item interest (gene, protein, phosphosite, etc.), second correlation item interest phenotype (typically log ratio expression phenotype vs. normal), remaining columns scores likelihood item belongs set (one column per set). thresh_type type thresh. Use 'percentile' include scores percentile given thresh (.e., 0.9 items 90th percentile, top 10 percent); 'list' include list set lists set lists order corresponding set columns input_df; 'val' apply single threshold value sets; 'values' use vector unique cutoffs set (needs order sets specified columns input_df") thresh Depends thresh_type. list lists items set (names colnames scores); numeric vector threshold scores set (order colnames scores input_df), single percentile value 0 1 (.e., thresh=0.9, 90th percentile score highest scoring 10 items included set scoring regimen) (thresh ="" supported time, result Kolgorov-Smirnoff statistic; may worked alternate scoring method later ). thresh_action Either "include", "exclude (default)", "adjust"; specifies treat set contain minimum number items contains items; option used predefined lists items sets (number items given set meet requirements, set skipped). min_set_size, max_set_size minimum/maximum number items set needs analysis proceed. max_score, min_score optional numeric vector minimum/maximum boundaries clip scores set. psuedocount Psuedocount (pc) used rescaling set scores: (score - min_score + pc)/(max_score - min_score +pc); needed prevent division 0 max_score==min_score (case, scores items set 1, equivalent standard GSEA); also allows users adjust weights scores close minimum scores set (unless min_score==max_score): psuedocount value approaches 0, scaled minimum scores also approach 0; psuedocount approaches infinity, scaled minimum scores approach scaled maximum scores (equal 1); value must larger 0. perms number permutations. p exponential scaling factor phenotype score (second column input_df). q exponential scaling factor likelihood score (weights). nThreads number threads use calculating permutaions. rng_seed Random seed. fork boolean. Whether pass "fork" type parameter makeCluster Unix-like machines. fdrMethod ORA method, WebGestaltR supports five FDR methods: holm, hochberg, hommel, bonferroni, BH . default BH.

title: Site Weighted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — multiswGsea
text: list Enrichment_Results, Items_in_Set Running_Sums. Enrichment_Results data frame row names gene set columns  "ES", "NES", "p_val", "fdr". Items_in_Set list one-column data frames. Describes genes  ranks set. Running_Sums Running sum scores along genes sorted ranked scores,  gene sets columns.

title: Site Weighted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — multiswGsea
text: formula weighting follows $$\frac{s_{j}^{q}|r_{j}|^{p}}{\sum s^{q}|r|^{p}}$$ r log ratio score, s likelihood score, j index gene.

title: Site Weighted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — multiswGsea
text: John Elizarraras

title: Site Weighted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — swGsea
text: input_df data frame first column name item interest (gene, protein, phosphosite, etc.), second correlation item interest phenotype (typically log ratio expression phenotype vs. normal), remaining columns scores likelihood item belongs set (one column per set). thresh_type type thresh. Use 'percentile' include scores percentile given thresh (.e., 0.9 items 90th percentile, top 10 percent); 'list' include list set lists set lists order corresponding set columns input_df; 'val' apply single threshold value sets; 'values' use vector unique cutoffs set (needs order sets specified columns input_df") thresh Depends thresh_type. list lists items set (names colnames scores); numeric vector threshold scores set (order colnames scores input_df), single percentile value 0 1 (.e., thresh=0.9, 90th percentile score highest scoring 10 items included set scoring regimen) (thresh ="" supported time, result Kolgorov-Smirnoff statistic; may worked alternate scoring method later ). thresh_action Either "include", "exclude (default)", "adjust"; specifies treat set contain minimum number items contains items; option used predefined lists items sets (number items given set meet requirements, set skipped). min_set_size, max_set_size minimum/maximum number items set needs analysis proceed. max_score, min_score optional numeric vector minimum/maximum boundaries clip scores set. psuedocount Psuedocount (pc) used rescaling set scores: (score - min_score + pc)/(max_score - min_score +pc); needed prevent division 0 max_score==min_score (case, scores items set 1, equivalent standard GSEA); also allows users adjust weights scores close minimum scores set (unless min_score==max_score): psuedocount value approaches 0, scaled minimum scores also approach 0; psuedocount approaches infinity, scaled minimum scores approach scaled maximum scores (equal 1); value must larger 0. perms number permutations. p exponential scaling factor phenotype score (second column input_df). q exponential scaling factor likelihood score (weights). nThreads number threads use calculating permutaions. rng_seed Random seed. fork boolean. Whether pass "fork" type parameter makeCluster Unix-like machines.

title: Site Weighted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — swGsea
text: list Enrichment_Results, Items_in_Set Running_Sums. Enrichment_Results data frame row names gene set columns  "ES", "NES", "p_val", "fdr". Items_in_Set list one-column data frames. Describes genes  ranks set. Running_Sums Running sum scores along genes sorted ranked scores,  gene sets columns.

title: Site Weighted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — swGsea
text: formula weighting follows $$\frac{s_{j}^{q}|r_{j}|^{p}}{\sum s^{q}|r|^{p}}$$ r log ratio score, s likelihood score, j index gene.

text: idsInSet list set names member IDs. costs vector length add weights penalty, .e. 1/-logP. topN number sets (less completes early) return. nThreads number processes use. Windows, fallbacks 1.

title: Weighted Set Cover — weightedSetCover
text: list topSets coverage. topSets list set IDs. coverage percentage IDs covered top sets.

title: Weighted Set Cover — weightedSetCover
text: Zhiao Shi, Yuxing Liao
